description:
Considered as the third installment in the highly popular "When They Cry" series by 07th Expansion, Umineko no Naku Koro ni takes place on the island of Rokkenjima (六軒島), owned by the immensely wealthy Ushiromiya family. As customary per year, the entire family is gathering on the island for a conference that discusses the current financial situations of each respective person. Because of the family head's poor health, this year involves the topic of the head of the family’s inheritance and how it will be distributed.

However, the family is unaware that the distribution of his wealth is the least of Ushiromiya Kinzo's (family head) concerns for this year's family conference. After being told that his end was approaching by his longtime friend and physician, Kinzo is desperate to meet his life's true love one last time: the Golden Witch, Beatrice. Having immersed himself in black magic for many of the later years in his life, Kinzo instigates a ceremony to revive his beloved upon his family's arrival on Rokkenjima. Soon after, a violent typhoon traps the family on the island and a string of mysterious murders commence, forcing the eighteen people on the island to fight for their lives in a deadly struggle between fantasy and reality.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

name.native: フレデリカ・ベルンカステル
エヴァ・ベアトリーチェ

node.description: Main member of the 07th Expansion circle and creator of the popular visual/sound novel series 'When They Cry', including Higurashi no Naku Koro ni, Umineko no Naku Koro ni, and the currently releasing Ciconia no Naku Koro ni. He also is the creator of two visual/sound novels titled Rose Guns Days and Higanbana no Saku Yoru ni, and wrote the Lucia Route of Visual Arts' Key's visual novel Rewrite. His pen name is a tribute to Reina of Final Fantasy V.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choco_kiku) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊地洋子)

Married to [Eiji Suganuma](https://anilist.co/staff/109167/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [Youko Kikuchi (菊地陽子)](https://anilist.co/staff/141535/), different kanji._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choco_kiku) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊地洋子)

A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

Akiko Shikata is a singer-songwriter and composer. She was born in Tokyo, Japan.  She's known for her contribution in the video game series Ar Tonelico and Shadow Hearts.  She also gave her contribution on Umineko no Naku Koro ni musics, such as the OP Theme for the Visual Novel and the Anime.  Recently she released her second maxi single, Inori no Kanata, that is Tales of Symphonia TETHE'ALLA Hen ED Theme.  She sings in multiple languages such as Italian, German, English, Celtic and Hymmnos, Ar Tonelico's Official Language.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/higu_dai)

Most famous for his soundtracks for Higurashi no Naku Koro ni Kai and Umineko no Naku Koro ni visual novels.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Official Website](http://jimang.com/)

Member of Sound Horizon, who serves as its narrator and one of its vocalists.  He has been with the group since their doujin album "Lost" in 2002.  He most recently performed the ending theme for the show Umineko no Naku Koro ni.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷口守泰)

A veteran animator with a career spanning nearly 60 years.
